text: Food insecurity encompasses more than just poor people going hungry. Like living in a food desert with no access to fresh food. Like not having a parent, for various reasons, providing regular meals for their kids. It’s not a simple term, neither are the reasons not getting the food you need.

text: “Food insecurity” differs from the more conversational “hunger” because many people we consider food insecure don’t go hungry, but they also don’t have the money to buy healthy or high quality food.

text:
It’s an adjective. A human can be hungry (doesn’t have access to food now) or food insecure (may have food now, but not regularly).

“Hungry” works in political communication; “food insecure” works in designing & delivering assistance- actual governing.

I think the idea is to use ordinary language instead of more obtuse terms. “Kids going hungry” has more punch than “food insecure children,” for example. We can’t reach regular folks if we insist on convoluted terms.

Yeah. But "food insecurity" is a good example of another problem - the meaning gets stretched and it loses its precision.

The term originated among activists to talk about a real problem.  But activists tend to expand their area of concern and the term gets applied to more situations.

text:
"Unhoused" has crept in meaning too, expanding to couch surfers etc.  But that's a redundant and unnecessary term to begin with.

"Food insecurity" would be actually useful but now I steer away from it, and use a phrase like "not sure where their next meal is coming from".

Are you still eligible for SNAP Benefits? 

Starting on Sept.1, the federal government’s rules on how long certain people can receive SNAP benefits are changing. Most adults must work 20 hours a week to stay on SNAP. If you can't prove that you work enough, you can only get 3 months every 3 years.

text: I volunteered at a food bank years ago. The food was just tossed into bins and we were to sort it. Half the food had to be thrown out because the bins were filled with maggots. Jars were broken due to throwing other jars on top and the contents spewed all over everything else. It was pretty awful.

People know when they checkout at the grocery store or hear their neighbor has lost her job & can't find another.

They see it when they have no trouble finding great parking spaces at the mall.  They see the line at the Food Bank increasing exponentially.

The signs are all around.

author_description: Heliix Brief delivers fast, accessible updates on the latest biomedical research. We scan new papers published in Europe PMC and bring you clear, concise digests focused on relevance and impact.

text: This scoping review examines the growing evidence that food insecurity, the lack of reliable access to affordable, nutritious food, is a significant risk factor for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD).
author_description: Heliix Brief delivers fast, accessible updates on the latest biomedical research. We scan new papers published in Europe PMC and bring you clear, concise digests focused on relevance and impact.

text: Future research should focus on better quantifying food insecurity and exploring how improved food security can prevent and reverse the negative health impacts of this emerging public health crisis.

text:
Pasadena has a homelessness prevention program, food bank, outreach workers & more. Altadena almost totally burned down last year they are I think seeing more clients.

There’s All Roads in Boulder, CO & I’m sure people reading this know of places in their own regions.
